author: Harper Lee
review: A gripping, heart-wrenching, and wholly remarkable tale of coming-of-age in a South poisoned by virulent prejudice.

author: George Orwell
review: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A novel of the Jazz Age that explores themes of decadence, idealism, resistance to change, social upheaval, and excess.

author: Jane Austen
review: A romantic novel of manners that explores the issues of marriage, money, and love in the British Regency.

author: Herman Melville
review: An epic tale of the voyage of the whaling ship Pequod and its captain, Ahab, who obsessively pursues the great white whale, Moby Dick.

author: Leo Tolstoy
review: A historical novel that intertwines the lives of private and public individuals during the time of the Napoleonic wars.
